==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|Ōsaka}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|大坂}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おお|さか|yomi=kun}}

oposaka → oɸosaka → owosaka → oosaka → oːsaka. Compound of {{compound|大|tr1=ō|t1=great|阪|tr2=saka|t2=hill|lang=ja}}. The geographical area was historically known as {{m|ja|小坂|tr=Osaka, Ozaka||little hill}} and was renamed to Ōsaka / Ōzaka "great hill". Originally spelled as 大坂 before being replaced with 大阪.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|おおさか|acc=h}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|おおさか|proper|hhira=おほさか}}

# [[Ōsaka]], a prefecture of Japan.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おお|さか|k2=ざか|r=y|yomi=kun}}

opo saka → opozaka → oɸozaka → owozaka → oozaka → oːzaka. Medial /s/ voices to /z/ due to [[w:Rendaku|rendaku]]. Compound of {{compound|大|tr1=ō|t1=great|阪|tr2=saka|t2=hill|lang=ja}}. The geographical area was historically known as {{m|ja|小坂|tr=Osaka, Ozaka||little hill}} and was renamed to Ōsaka / Ōzaka "great hill". Originally spelled as {{m|ja|大坂}} before being replaced with 大阪.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|おおざか|proper|hhira=おほざか}}

# historical reading for present-day [[Ōsaka]] prefecture.
